item.title: Auto restarter
item.dc:creator: @tj007razor tj007razor
item.description:
@tj007razor wrote:

I have a working auto restarter (antilag.java) by xerocheeze but it has one flaw. (or my server) The problem is, when I run the server, it opens Java.exe and when the auto restarter restarts the server, it starts java.exe again(because it is in the compiler) without ending the other one.

[code]// This resets server every 30 mins to stop lag - xerozcheez
import java.io.*;

public class antilag
{

public int ResetTimer = 0;

public void resetserver()
{
misc.println(“RESETING SERVER!!!”);
misc.println(“Saving all games…”);
PlayerHandler.kickAllPlayers = true;
misc.println(“GAME SUCCESSFULLY SAVED FOR ALL PLAYERS”);
ResetTimer = 0;
runserver();
closeListener();

}
public void process()
{
ResetTimer += 1;
if(ResetTimer >= 1500)
{
resetserver();
}
}

public void runserver()
{
try
{
String run = “compile.bat”;
String xstr = “./”+run;
Runtime.getRuntime().exec(xstr);

}
catch (IOException ioe)
{
ioe.printStackTrace();
}
}

public void closeListener()
{
try {
server.shutdownClientHandler = true;
if(server.clientListener != null) server.clientListener.close();
server.clientListener = null;

	}

catch(java.lang.Exception __ex)
{
__ex.printStackTrace();
}
}
}[/code]

Anyone know how to add in code that might stop the old process?

btw…my compiler is the same thing as runserver.bat
